Bargrisar was a stone-[[Giant]] in [[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North|''The Lord of the Rings: War in the North'']] that led a league of [[Orcs]] to destroy the nests of [[Eagles]] in the North.

==History==

Bargrisar was a notoriously vicious and violent Stone Giant who was shunned by other Stone Giants due to his antisocial nature. This shunning aggravated Bargrisar's combative tendencies and created a reputation that eventually drew the attention of [[Sauron]]. The Dark Lord sent one of his servants, [[Agandaûr]], to successfully persuade Bargrisar to swear allegiance to Sauron.

After forming an alliance with Sauron, Bargrisar and Agandaûr planned to kill the [[Eagles]] and plunder the North. They raised an army and led an attack on the Eagles, slaughtering them and destroying their eggs. As they was doing so, Gandalf sent a trio of warriors - [[Eradan]], [[Andriel]], and [[Farin]] - to investigate the hiding of Bargrisar's Trolls. 

The trio, with the help of the eagle [[Beleram]], destroyed most of Bargrisar's army before he was ready to destroy the remaining [[Men]] of the North. Eventually they found and fought Bargrisar, successfully killing him after he feigned death and Beleram swooped down and plucked his eyes out.<ref name=":0">''The Lord of the Rings: War in the North''</ref>
